verses.text_plain: And an angel of the Lord came up from Gilgal to Bochim, and said, I made you to go up out of Egypt, and have brought you unto the land which I sware unto your fathers; and I said, I will never break my covenant with you.
verses.verse_html:
1And an angel of the Lord came up from Gilgal to Bochim, and said, I made you to go up out of Egypt, and have brought you unto the land which I sware unto your fathers; and I said, I will never break my covenant with you. ▼
▼ angel: or, messenger

tokens.text: I made you to go up

verses.text_plain: And ye shall make no league with the inhabitants of this land; ye shall throw down their altars: but ye have not obeyed my voice: why have ye done this?
verses.verse_html: 2And ye shall make no league with the inhabitants of this land; ye shall throw down their altars: but ye have not obeyed my voice: why have ye done this?

verses.text_plain: Wherefore I also said, I will not drive them out from before you; but they shall be as thorns in your sides, and their gods shall be a snare unto you.
verses.verse_html: 3Wherefore I also said, I will not drive them out from before you; but they shall be as thorns in your sides, and their gods shall be a snare unto you.

tokens.text: I will not drive them out

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when the angel of the Lord spake these words unto all the children of Israel, that the people lifted up their voice, and wept.
verses.verse_html: 4And it came to pass, when the angel of the Lord spake these words unto all the children of Israel, that the people lifted up their voice, and wept.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when the angel

verses.text_plain: And they called the name of that place Bochim: and they sacrificed there unto the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
5And they called the name of that place Bochim: and they sacrificed there unto the Lord. ▼
▼ Bochim: that is, Weepers

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Bochim: that is, Weepers

verses.text_plain: And when Joshua had let the people go, the children of Israel went every man unto his inheritance to possess the land.
verses.verse_html: 6And when Joshua had let the people go, the children of Israel went every man unto his inheritance to possess the land.

verses.text_plain: And the people served the Lord all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders that outlived Joshua, who had seen all the great works of the Lord, that he did for Israel.
verses.verse_html:
7And the people served the Lord all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders that outlived Joshua, who had seen all the great works of the Lord, that he did for Israel. ▼
▼ outlived: Heb. prolonged days after

footnotes.body_html: ▼ outlived: Heb. prolonged days after

verses.text_plain: And Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died, being an hundred and ten years old.
verses.verse_html: 8And Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died, being an hundred and ten years old.

verses.text_plain: And they buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnath–heres, in the mount of Ephraim, on the north side of the hill Gaash.
verses.verse_html:
9And they buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnath–heres, in the mount of Ephraim, on the north side of the hill Gaash. ▼
▼ Timnath–heres: also called, Timnath–serah

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Timnath–heres: also called, Timnath–serah

verses.text_plain: And also all that generation were gathered unto their fathers: and there arose another generation after them, which knew not the Lord, nor yet the works which he had done for Israel.
verses.verse_html: 10And also all that generation were gathered unto their fathers: and there arose another generation after them, which knew not the Lord, nor yet the works which he had done for Israel.

verses.text_plain: And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the Lord, and served Baalim:
verses.verse_html: 11And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the Lord, and served Baalim:

verses.text_plain: And they forsook the Lord God of their fathers, which brought them out of the land of Egypt, and followed other gods, of the gods of the people that were round about them, and bowed themselves unto them, and provoked the Lord to anger.
verses.verse_html: 12And they forsook the Lord God of their fathers, which brought them out of the land of Egypt, and followed other gods, of the gods of the people that were round about them, and bowed themselves unto them, and provoked the Lord to anger.

tokens.text: themselves unto them, and provoked the Lord

verses.text_plain: And they forsook the Lord, and served Baal and Ashtaroth.
verses.verse_html: 13And they forsook the Lord, and served Baal and Ashtaroth.

verses.text_plain: And the anger of the Lord was hot against Israel, and he delivered them into the hands of spoilers that spoiled them, and he sold them into the hands of their enemies round about, so that they could not any longer stand before their enemies.
verses.verse_html: 14And the anger of the Lord was hot against Israel, and he delivered them into the hands of spoilers that spoiled them, and he sold them into the hands of their enemies round about, so that they could not any longer stand before their enemies.

verses.text_plain: Whithersoever they went out, the hand of the Lord was against them for evil, as the Lord had said, and as the Lord had sworn unto them: and they were greatly distressed.
verses.verse_html: 15Whithersoever they went out, the hand of the Lord was against them for evil, as the Lord had said, and as the Lord had sworn unto them: and they were greatly distressed.

tokens.text: unto them: and they were greatly

verses.text_plain: Nevertheless the Lord raised up judges, which delivered them out of the hand of those that spoiled them.
verses.verse_html:
16Nevertheless the Lord raised up judges, which delivered them out of the hand of those that spoiled them. ▼
▼ delivered: Heb. saved

verses.text_plain: And yet they would not hearken unto their judges, but they went a whoring after other gods, and bowed themselves unto them: they turned quickly out of the way which their fathers walked in, obeying the commandments of the Lord; but they did not so.
verses.verse_html: 17And yet they would not hearken unto their judges, but they went a whoring after other gods, and bowed themselves unto them: they turned quickly out of the way which their fathers walked in, obeying the commandments of the Lord; but they did not so.

tokens.text: And yet they would not hearken

verses.text_plain: And when the Lord raised them up judges, then the Lord was with the judge, and delivered them out of the hand of their enemies all the days of the judge: for it repented the Lord because of their groanings by reason of them that oppressed them and vexed them.
verses.verse_html: 18And when the Lord raised them up judges, then the Lord was with the judge, and delivered them out of the hand of their enemies all the days of the judge: for it repented the Lord because of their groanings by reason of them that oppressed them and vexed them.

tokens.text: by reason of them that oppressed

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when the judge was dead, that they returned, and corrupted themselves more than their fathers, in following other gods to serve them, and to bow down unto them; they ceased not from their own doings, nor from their stubborn way.
verses.verse_html:
19And it came to pass, when the judge was dead, that they returned, and corrupted themselves more than their fathers, in following other gods to serve them, and to bow down unto them; they ceased not from their own doings, nor from their stubborn way. ▼
▼ corrupted…: or, were corrupt
 , ▼
▼ ceased…: Heb. let nothing fall of their

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when the judge

footnotes.body_html: ▼ corrupted…: or, were corrupt

footnotes.body_text: ▼ ceased…: Heb. let nothing fall of their
footnotes.body_html: ▼ ceased…: Heb. let nothing fall of their

verses.text_plain: And the anger of the Lord was hot against Israel; and he said, Because that this people hath transgressed my covenant which I commanded their fathers, and have not hearkened unto my voice;
verses.verse_html: 20And the anger of the Lord was hot against Israel; and he said, Because that this people hath transgressed my covenant which I commanded their fathers, and have not hearkened unto my voice;

verses.text_plain: I also will not henceforth drive out any from before them of the nations which Joshua left when he died:
verses.verse_html: 21I also will not henceforth drive out any from before them of the nations which Joshua left when he died:

verses.text_plain: That through them I may prove Israel, whether they will keep the way of the Lord to walk therein, as their fathers did keep it, or not.
verses.verse_html: 22That through them I may prove Israel, whether they will keep the way of the Lord to walk therein, as their fathers did keep it, or not.

tokens.text: That through them I may prove

verses.text_plain: Therefore the Lord left those nations, without driving them out hastily; neither delivered he them into the hand of Joshua.
verses.verse_html:
23Therefore the Lord left those nations, without driving them out hastily; neither delivered he them into the hand of Joshua. ▼
▼ left: or, suffered
